page.title: 07FARMING - ARABLE
page.content: The majority of the land is owned by the Welbys of Denton, Lincs. It's farmed by two men in different systems Alan Limb as tenant of Manor Farm Braceby and Manor Farm Sapperton, Giles Halfhead share farms Chestnut Farm Sapperton in partnership with the owner,Sir Bruno Welby. Soil structure is heavy loam lying on clay with a seam of Limestone brash on the banks of the hollow running north to south at the west of the area. Main crops grown are{winter wheat}for bread or animal feed,{winter & spring barley}to local maltster for beer,{oil seed rape grown for its oil used in margarine. {Fodder beet, turnips & peas}are break crops in the farm rotation & go for sheep feed. The Sapperton farm has a workshop with a qualified mechanic & a student who do all the repairs to the implements & vehicles of both farms.
